Name: Prohibit prosecutors from using creative expression as evidence against a criminal defendant without clear and convincing proof. (A. 127/S. 1738)
Title: Resolution calling on the State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, A. 127/S. 1738, to prohibit prosecutors from using creative expression as evidence against a criminal defendant without clear and convincing proof that there is a literal, factual nexus between the creative expression and the facts of the case

History.Description: This Resolution was Introduced by Council
This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
